title: Details of the original advert for the Estate Agency Framework opportunity

content:
Dear FOI Team,
I would be most grateful if you would provide me, under the Freedom of Information Act, details in respect to the contract below.
Estate Agent for the disposal of council owned (residential) Properties:
https://uk.eu-supply.com/app/rfq/rwlentr...
The details we require are:
• Date of the original advert for this opportunity and the link to it?
• Suppliers who applied for inclusion on each framework/contract and were successful & not successful at the PQQ & ITT stages
• Could you please also provide a copy of the service/product specification given to all bidders for when this contract was last advertised?
• Who is the senior officer (outside of procurement) responsible for this contract?
Thank you for your help.
Yours sincerely
Sai Parker

Dear Sai Parker,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Blenheim Park
Estates which we received on 20/11/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1. The RFQ was issued out on the 28^th of September 2023.
2. [1]
https://uk.eu-supply.com/app/rfq/edittra...
3. There was only one bid submitted.
4. The Specification is below:
Sheffield City Council requires an Estate Agent to facilitate the sale of
a number of Council owned properties over a period of 3 years. We need to
dispose of housing properties that have been declared surplus to Sheffield
City Council’s requirements. All properties will be located within
Sheffield.
An initial batch of properties are now ready for sale, with a further
requirement to be listed once they have gone through the Councils surplus
declaration process.
The maximum contract value over the 3-year period is £120,000.
The initial properties for sale are listed below:
• 46 Church Street, S35 9WE
• 43 Endcliffe Rise Road, S11 8RU
• The Lodge, Totley Hall Lane, S17 4AA
• 30 Vicarage Lane, S17 3GX
• Rivelin Lodge, Manchester Road, S6 6GH
• 2 Beauchief Cottages, Beauchief Abbey Lane, S8 7BD
Our requirements from an Estate Agent are as follows:
• Property Inspection/Valuation
• Marketing Package
• Printed Brochure
• Office Promotion including database of existing clients
• Online Exposure via external website and company website
• Photography of property
• Floor Plans
• Energy Performance Certificate
• Sales Board
• Advertising
• Property Viewings
The senior officer responsible for this contract is
[2][
email address
]
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be

If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you

Kind Regards,

Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear FOI,
Further to the response dated 18/12/23 from Sheffield Council, there is a link provided to the original advert for this opportunity. However the link takes me to a page that says I am not authorised to view it. I am registered with the Mercell Portal and can access the site successfully and view other opportunities, past and present.
Therefore I am still unable to establish that the opportunity was advertised, leading to my request in the first place.
Having alerts in place that notify our business of any such opportunities should mean that we would have been alerted to this particular opportunity, and we would have bid, however we did not receive any notifications. It also seems unusual that only 1 bid was received. Was this advert restricted in any way?
Can you provide proof of the advert by another means?
Many thanks
Yours sincerely,
Sai Parker

Dear Sai Parker
Internal Review of Freedom of Information Request – Reference – FOI /
969856
Thank you for your email of 19 December 2023 requesting an internal review
of our response to your request relating to a tender for estate agent
services. Our response would be due on 19 January 2024.
You complained that the link we provided to the tender did not allow you
to view it, despite being registered with the Mercell Portal.
We uphold your complaint because our answer was not complete. We should
have provided you with this additional information:
The RFQ was sent out as a Restricted Tender. Only three suppliers were
invited to bid. Out of the three invited, only one supplier submitted a
bid.
Nobody else would have seen the opportunity and wouldn’t have been
notified of it as it wasn’t advertised.
If you are dissatisfied with this review, you can make a complaint to the
Information Commissioner’s Office: [1][
email address
]
Yours sincerely,
